metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2612 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Jean-Baptiste Cayrou discovered that the shiftfs file system in the Ubuntu Linux kernel contained a race condition when handling inode locking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel deadlock). Jean-Baptiste Cayrou discovered that the shiftfs file system in the Ubuntu Linux kernel contained a race condition when handling inode locking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel deadlock).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-73-generic - 5.15.0-73.80
linux-image-5.15.0-73-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-73.80
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-73-generic - 5.15.0-73.80
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-73-generic-64k - 5.15.0-73.80
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1037-aws - 5.15.0-1037.41
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-73.80').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1037.41').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1039.46').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was pending [5.19.0-1027.30~22.04.2]').
